body_html:
ok, you are right. From what I understand by now the tf.GraphKeys.md conventions are not about the names of Variabels but collections those Variabels should be added.

So the following lines should be in there:

    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.WEIGHTS, self.kernel)
    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.BIASES,  self.bias)

I am happy to put this into a pull request.
body_text:
ok, you are right. From what I understand by now the tf.GraphKeys.md conventions are not about the names of Variabels but collections those Variabels should be added.
So  the following lines should be in there:
    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.WEIGHTS, self.kernel)
    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.BIASES,  self.bias)

I am happy to put this into a pull request.
body:
ok, you are right. From what I understand by now the [tf.GraphKeys.md](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/api_docs/python/functions_and_classes/shard8/tf.GraphKeys.md) conventions are not about the names of Variabels but collections those Variabels should be added. 

So  the following lines should be in there:

````
    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.WEIGHTS, self.kernel)
    tf.add_to_collection(tf.GraphKeys.BIASES,  self.bias)
````

I am happy to put this into a pull request.
